title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Officer Scott MacIsaac, a 30-year veteran of the Boston Police Department, died from cancer on Friday.
MacIsaac served in the U.S. Army and joined the Boston Police Department in 1995, recently working in West Roxbury.
He was commended for his role in the Boston Marathon bombings and lifesaving actions during his career.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins' Jeremy Swayman and Tampa Bay Lightning's Andrei Vasilevskiy fought during the Stadium Series game in Tampa.
The goalies dropped the gloves after a skirmish involving Lightning forward Brandon Hagel and Bruins' Charlie McAvoy.
Both were penalized, but stayed in the game, which ended in a 6-5 Bruins shootout loss.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with murder after shooting Fall River mother Elizabeth Almeida and son Nicholas Almedia.
Elizabeth and Nicholas Almedia were found with gunshot wounds on Barnes Street and pronounced dead at the hospital.
Cole, in a relationship with Elizabeth, faces arraignment Monday on murder and firearm possession charges.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers rescued from a malfunctioning lift at Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, New Hampshire.
Fire departments from Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford conducted the rescue operation in under an hour and a half.
One skier was hospitalized; others were checked for injuries and returned to the lodge for warmth.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran sentenced to an additional 11 months for obstructing justice and making false statements.
Tran, serving an 18-month sentence for fraud, misled investigators about a letter related to pandemic unemployment benefits.
Tran's criminal history includes ethics violations and charges for coercing an elderly woman and stealing her firearms.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month for January, scoring eight goals in 14 games.
Minten, acquired from Maple Leafs, excelled as Bruins achieved an 11-2-1 record last month.
Bruins set to rely on Minten in Stadium Series without top centers Elias Lindholm and Pavel Zacha.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Seven crew members are presumed dead after the 72-foot fishing vessel Lily Jean sank off Gloucester.
Search efforts covered 1,000 square miles using cutters, aircraft, and small boats before being suspended.
The lost crew included captain Gus Sanfilippo, father Sean Therrien, and fisheries observer Jada Samitt.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins dressed as colonial-era Patriots for the Stadium Series game at Raymond James Stadium in Tampa.
Players customized their outfits using costumes supplied by Boston Costume, tying into Boston's historical roots.
The Lightning also dressed for the occasion, wearing classic Tampa Bay Buccaneers 'Creamsicle' football uniforms with helmets.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to the White Sox for minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl.
Hicks, acquired from the Devers trade in 2025, posted an 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings for Boston.
Red Sox will send cash to Chicago as part of the trade; Hicks earns $12.5 million in 2026.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: 'Something in the Way' festival at Roadrunner showcased two dozen indie bands over the weekend.
Bands such as The Hotelier, Her New Knife, and Angel Du$t performed during the event.
Boston.com photographer Ben Stas captured images during the festival's first day.
